title: Meet Basic Eligibility Requirements
description: To join as a Police Constable, the minimum educational qualification is passing the G.C.E. O/L examination. For Sub-Inspector, a G.C.E. A/L pass is required. Applicants must also meet strict age, height, and physical fitness standards and have a clean record.

title: Recruitment Process and Basic Training
description: Successfully pass the police recruitment process, which includes a written exam, a physical fitness test, and an interview. Upon selection, undergo intensive basic training at a police college, which covers law, police procedures, physical training, and firearms.
salaryRangeLKR: Stipend during training, then initial government salary scale

title: Police Constable / Sub-Inspector
description: Begin your service at a police station. Your duties will include patrolling, responding to public complaints, conducting preliminary investigations, traffic control, and maintaining law and order in your assigned area.
qualifications: Confirmed appointment in the Sri Lanka Police

title: Promotion to Sergeant / Inspector of Police (IP)
description: Through departmental examinations and a good service record, you can earn promotions. Sergeants and IPs take on more supervisory roles, leading teams of constables, managing station duties, and handling more serious cases.
institutes: N/A - Promotion within the police service

title: Senior Gazetted Ranks (ASP, SP, etc.)
description: Highly capable officers can rise to the gazetted ranks, starting from Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP). These are senior leadership roles involving command of a police division or a specialized unit. A university degree becomes increasingly important for these higher ranks.
